item.title: 1187 mod released (Episode 2)
item.dc:creator: Secomed
item.description:
Theevilpplz:

Firstly, people can create their own Houndeye, of course they look similar. They are both based off the Half-Life Houndeye, and both the BM and 1187 team wanted to keep it close to the original.
Secondly, how do you know they stole weapons from other mods if you stopped playing when you got the pistol?
Thirdly, I assure you it gets relatively easier to figure out once you are out of the intro area and into the underground.

impulse 101 jack ass :meh:

Read full topic

item.title: 1187 mod released (Episode 2)
item.dc:creator: Secomed
item.description:
I tried it…im gunna list what i liked about it, and what i didnt.

Pros
I like the music, it really helped set the mood
interesting concept for a story
New textures

Cons
Definitely stole the hound eye right from the BMS Alpha leak
HARD!!
Stole weapons from other mods
The way the screen moves up and down when you walk. (it gave me a seizure…LITERALLY)
The irons sights

So when i first started playing, i really like the intro, despite the shitty animation of gman. But when you enter the room and you leave, the first thing you want is a gun. So for the first 20 minuets i played the damn thing, the whole time i was think “When am i gunna get to shoot something?” and after i found the healthkit weapon thing, i still couldnt figure out what to do with it!! So i had to actually look up a walk through FOR A DAMN MOD!!! but after i found out what to do, and you enter the room with all those fucking poison crabs, i picked up the pistol BUT THERE WAS NO AMMO IN IT!!! and thats where i stopped playing

Read full topic

item.title: 1187 mod released (Episode 2)
item.dc:creator: bulbman
item.description:
danielsangeo:

And when you die once, you can never play the game again. Because you’re dead.

Oh yes the “If it’s 'sposed to be realistic then u can only die once! U gotta have total realism or no realism, no in 'tween.”
You can make some parts of a game realistic and others not. Just because it’s not your kind of game doesn’t make it bad. That’s like saying COD games suck because you can aim down sights and knife people, or saying Halo sucks because you can’t. The only reason I responded is because the only reasons people gave about why the mod “sucks” sounded pretty much like “it’s not like HL2s gameplay style.” It actually is, just from the POV of a citizen.

Read full topic

item.title: 1187 mod released (Episode 2)
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
bulbman:

I liked the godamned mod! Fuck fast-paced shit. I thought it was very well thought out and entertaining, a lot better than many of the mods out there. Also, the bobbing and iron sighting are for realism, you try running sideways and keeping your head striaght, as for the iron sights, it makes sense, when you use a gun a magical crosshiar doesn’t appear to help you aim, you use the sights, that’s what they’re for.

And when you die once, you can never play the game again. Because you’re dead.

Read full topic

item.title: 1187 mod released (Episode 2)
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
I just beat 1187. The Combine are at the end (spoiler in the black text at the end of this post). The vorts are still enemies because they are still wearing the slave shackles. I suspect an in-game explanation is that after the destruction of the Nihilanth, many vorts remained slaves to their Nihilanthian programming whilst others rebelled against it. This latter group is who you see in HL2.

Spoilers in the black below:
[COLOR=‘Black’]After clearing the restaurant, you overhear a group from the Omega Squad speaking with…well, my opinion is that it’s an Advisor. Bennett suggests you take the car to a small town called “Outercurve” (I think that’s what it’s called). Once you get to the town, you have to deal with hordes of Omega Squad and a couple of helicopter gunships. Once those are eliminated, John and Bennett meet up with you for battles with vortigaunts. Once those are eliminated, you witness a gigantic portal opening up in the sky and a ginormous number of Combine coming through it. John shouts out that they can take them --that we didn’t come all this way to die now – and a Combine gunship comes at you. My opinion is that it’s the start of the Seven Hours War. The screen fades to black and…cue the Gman.

Read full topic

item.title: 1187 mod released (Episode 2)
item.dc:creator: Theevilpplz
item.description:
Medevilae:

…Right

After BM Incident =/= After defeat of Ninalith

Half-Life Saga Story Guide - https://members.shaw.ca/halflifestory/

I like how you ignored the bit where I say just that.

Theevilpplz:

Wrong. If you listen to the news in-game, it takes place after the BM Incident, portal storms everywhere. While this could still mean that it takes place before Freeman finishes in Xen, it also says Dr. Breen is touring the country, giving speeches about what happen. That implies it’s been a bit since the BM incident.

Read full topic

item.title: 1187 mod released (Episode 2)
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
Dias:

what exactly did he do to ruin it for you?

Spoke with the voice of a 15 year old boy reading lousy monologues poorly disguised as cool dialogues.

Few FPS games can successfully pull off the sidekick character. This just isn’t one of those games.

I would have totally ignored this if the rest of the game wasn’t garbage.
